website_summaries.verdict: Insulated water bottle perfect for long runs on hot summer days.
pros: Podium chill insulation keeps water cool
The bottle also has reflective strips
Storage pocket is nice and roomy
cons: Water does eventually warm up, especially in very hot conditions

customer_reviews.title: iPhone 6S Plus (w slender case) fits inside zippered pocket of the 2017 version
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the 2017 CamelBak Quick Grip. At first glance, the zippered pocket seems too small to fit an iPhone 6S+, however the material is stretchy and the depth of the pocket allows a 6S+ (with slender case) and key fob to fit in the pocket. I am able to zip it up completely with the phone and key inside. I have not used the item for long and cannot comment on how much wear and tear carrying a phone and key might cause to the pocket. For now, I am very pleased essential items fit. This is the first time I have tried a CamelBak Quick Grip so I can't compare to the earlier model.
customer_reviews.author: Dave D.

customer_reviews.title: ... been using this for about a month and I love it so much
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for about a month and I love it so much!!! At first it took some getting used to and can feel pretty heavy if your phone is in it, but on it's own it is so great! I took it for 12 miles yesterday and didn't get tired of holding it once!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stays cold
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using bottles with neoprene sleeves to help keep heat from my hand away from the ice water inside the bottle. That has only worked somewhat. This bottle is insulated, and after a decent-length run, the water was gone but there was still plenty of ice left in the bottle. My hand is really small, but the drawstring on the handgrip kept the bottle nice and snug
customer_reviews.author: ChristyDTX

customer_reviews.title: I have had really good luck with CamelBak products in the past - so ...
customer_reviews.text: Previously I had a Nathan running water bottle and after about a month the cap started to leak. I have had really good luck with CamelBak products in the past - so even though this was a larger bottle (and a little more unwieldy to run with) it's been great and hasn't leaked on me at all. The pouch easily holds my iPhone 7 and a key or ID/cash.
customer_reviews.author: jcazz

customer_reviews.title: I would order another one. Great idea for running hands-free
customer_reviews.text: I love that it is hands-free. I have arthritis in my wrists and thumbs so I love that part of it. This is the second one I have purchased and the quality is not the same for the pouch. It is much thinner and seems like it will be less durable. The strap is the same though and I love how tight I can make it. It is not as good an insulator as advertised. I put half water/half ice and it seems to melt within 20 minutes in the summer. Not a big deal to me- just worth mentioning if it makes a difference to you.
customer_reviews.author: BeachBody Coach

customer_reviews.title: Good concept, bad functionality
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a bottle to run with, this is going to be too heavy. Even when it was not filled all the way, my hand and arm got tired after only a couple of minutes-- and I am used to carrying some sort of bottle so it's not a physicality problem on my end. The nozzle is nice for working out because you don't have to open or close anything, but it is very hard to clean and I was afraid of mold. The pocket fits necessities like keys or gels, but would be too small for most phones (my iphone 6 didnt even fit).
customer_reviews.author: Katy K

customer_reviews.title: I love that I still have water at the end of ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm still getting used to this product. I love that I still have water at the end of my run, so the size is nice, but it's a little heavy when I first start out. I haven't tried loading anything into the pocket, for that reason. I think once I get used to it, the weight won't bother me as much. It's easy to get water while moving and doesn't leak.
customer_reviews.author: Nickinator

customer_reviews.title: Great water bottle with zipper pocket
customer_reviews.text: I tried a hydrating backpack but I slipped around and water was really sloshing around. Someone recommended this to me. It’s very comfortable to run with. Best parts 1) you squeeze it to drink so it doesn’t leak and super easy to clean 2) nice pocket that I put money, tissues, and my keys. Worst part for me is zipper pocket could be bigger. It does fit my iPhone XR but nothing else. Therefore, I usually wear leggings with a pocket for my phone. It’s worth the money. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and hold the bottle snuggly
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and hold the bottle snuggly. Two Nathan holders prior to this stretched out over time so we will see how this one holds up. Because my hands are smaller, it takes both hands to squeeze the bottle for water. And it did take a few minutes to get the hand comfortable. I don't run with a phone and I can live with the weight from the slightly larger bottle of water. It just reminds me to rehydrate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: The CamelBak bottle does a great job of keeping liquids cold. The bottle is fairly comfortable in my hand and doesn't bother me when I run. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that the adjustment strap doesn't hold quite as well as I'd like. I have to readjust the strap every so often while I'm running - I like the strap nice and tight around my hand.
customer_reviews.author: PB

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t keep water cold for long
customer_reviews.text: I like this product for the most part. I read that the pocket could hold an iPhone. I have a 6 and it couldn’t fit, and I have a case on it. It’s not the easiest to hold. I think they should maybe do a velcro adjuster for where your hand goes because what they have now loosens up. Maybe add a nice clip. It also doesn’t keep water cold. I had ice water in mine and within an hour it wasn’t cold.
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Color is not Cranberry as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The color of this bottle is orange not cranberry. In the pictures it is very clearly red and matches the description, but in reality it is very orange. Otherwise it functions well, just not very nice to look at. I would have returned it, but it was not delivered by Amazon so was a pain and not worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: diyguy

customer_reviews.title: Not great for running
customer_reviews.text: It didn't occur to me until I used it the first time that a big water bottle with a handle like this would be heavy when filled an awkward to hold. The pouch does hold my phone, but with water this set is too heavy for me to use when I run.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice handheld
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my favorite Nathan water bottle holder which is 9 years old. I needed one with a bigger pocket to carry an iPhone 8 while on trail runs. This works great. Plenty of room for the phone, which is in an Otterbox case. No problems.
customer_reviews.author: Waldo

customer_reviews.title: Good runners water bottle
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable to hold while running, and the outside compartment holds quite a few items. Gave it only 4 stars because the handle strap becomes loose and you have to keep pulling on it to tighten it back up, which can be quite bothersome when you are running. Other than that, it's a good water bottle.
customer_reviews.author: K Flo

customer_reviews.title: Inflexible, hard time holding while running
customer_reviews.text: Purchased when I forgot to pack other handheld water bottle on a move. The plastic is inflexible and unlike many similar bottles, you really do have to grip it while running. I have smaller hands and consistently find that my thumbs hurt when using it. The pocket holds my iPhone X which is nice, but not worth it in terms of comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Collins

customer_reviews.title: Fits iPhone, keeps liquid cold
customer_reviews.text: This water bottle is definitely worth the money. I’m run everyday, 8-12 miles, this keeps my water cold for 1.5 hours easy with 30-60 minutes of it being stored on the freezer. I have bought a Nathan and another knock off. The Nathan hand held it ok but the camalbak is far superior. I can fit my iPhone in it. I will be buying another one soon.
customer_reviews.author: consumer21

customer_reviews.title: Easy to get used to
customer_reviews.text: It felt very natural and was easy to get used to. I use the pocket for holding keys, and an armband for my phone, I doubt modern phones could fit in the pocket. At first I didn’t notice the cap could be twisted to shut off water flow, which is another cool feature.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Great race bottle
customer_reviews.text: Used this bottle for a 10 mile race. I found it to be awesome for holding my essentials, and despite's some reviews that it's bulky easy to hold. Let's face it any water bottle filled is cumbersome, but the strap wasn't uncomfortable and the cold water was worth it. The bottle stayed relatively cold till the end.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah kaufman

customer_reviews.title: Like the water bottle, like the strap, just not together.
customer_reviews.text: I like the water bottle, and I like the carry strap/bag, but I don't like them together. The strap doesn't come far enough up the water bottle, so it tips away from your hand. It is very uncomfortable to carry. The weight of the water bottle is not well balanced to the strap and turns your hand. The pocket fits my phone and car keys easily. The water bottle kept my water nice and cold for my entire run and was easy to switch from open to closed.
customer_reviews.author: Patience Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hiking
customer_reviews.text: The product is great all the way around. It is durable, light weight, carries all your goodies, and feels good to the touch. A friend recommended the product and I use it all the time when I hike and go out for long walks.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Fritzen

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: I take this on runs, to the gym and if I need to go out and don’t want to drag a purse along. It works, that being said it gets sweaty and slippery fast in runs even when the grip is pulled tight.
customer_reviews.author: TonksGrrl

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable grip, lousy lid.
customer_reviews.text: Grip is quite comfortable, small pocket is good for keys etc. Lid does not close tight no matter what and sloshing energy drink gets my hand sticky, not nice! Will probably use the strap with other bottles...
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: Fits a S8+
customer_reviews.text: I love these bottles. My old running hand bottle was over 6 years old and the pocket was so small on them. This one was is great. It stretches and even fits my S8+ but nothing else. You really have to squeeze it in.
customer_reviews.author: Jay G.

customer_reviews.title: Good and solid product
customer_reviews.text: The bottle is very practical Made out of couple of layers that keeps water cold for longer The cap is very good allowing to lock water in when unused. The grip is also important allowing me to carry it around easily and the pocket even fits my iPhone 6s Plus.. 😊
customer_reviews.author: Lior Pollack

customer_reviews.title: Great for long runs
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have success with hydration belts, and gave this a shot. Works amazing! Plenty of storage, I can keep all nutrition and in this with room to spare. It is easy to carry, it stays in place so you don't need to keep gripping it to stay on. As the weight of it can get a little annoying over the miles, you end up just switching hands and it becomes a non-issue, especially the weight gets lighter as you drink and use your nutrition over long runs. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great water bottle
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase! I bought this for my hubby for our daily walks/hikes. We usually walk 4-6 miles daily, this is easy to carry, and it holds keys/cards. My hubby also likes that the cap locks/unlocks.
customer_reviews.author: AME728

customer_reviews.title: Great bottle!
customer_reviews.text: Went on my fist fun the other day and was really pleased with the comfort and ease. Really like the bigger bottle for extra water.
customer_reviews.author: R. Myers

customer_reviews.title: No more heavy running shorts or pants
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Could fit my s8 with keys in it now my s10. Keeps the water cold for at least 4 to 5 miles. Probably more I just have to reached there yet. Purchased one for the woman because she loved it getting one for her mom!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a gift for my sister and she feel in love it. It's easy to handle and go to the gym with. the pich is a much added bonus and holds a good but of stuff such as gym key and car keys.
customer_reviews.author: Gary F.

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but not great
customer_reviews.text: The water bottle itself it great. The pouch is big enough to fit my iPhone which is what I needed, but it’s not very comfortable to Cary with the strap.
customer_reviews.author: Gina S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for large distances
customer_reviews.text: I recommend too much, perfect for large distances athletes, triathlon or running
customer_reviews.author: Grace M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice and snug in my hand but lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for trail running. My iPhone 11 Promax fits in the pocket (can't zip but fits snug).
customer_reviews.author: me skibba

customer_reviews.title: Great Running Water Bottle
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY am glad I bought this. I drink a lot of water so basically this lasts me like 5-6 miles, but the pouch can hold everything you need, phone (depending on the size phone you have), license, keys, music player. Very comfortable on my hand as well. Has been a great lifesaver with the hot weather and runs!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Steele

customer_reviews.title: Keeps fluid and fuel quite well during long runs
customer_reviews.text: It was my constant companion during my marathon and training. It keeps my fuel and fluid I need during my long runs. Can’t do my long runs without it
customer_reviews.author: EBD

customer_reviews.title: Great for runners or anyone living an active lifestyle
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 11 year-old daughter who recently joined a running club. This bottle/zipper pouch combo is perfect to drink from on the go and carries her money and id without any issue. It’s brightly colored and has reflective striping. The adjustable hand strap is such a great feature too. Buy this bottle knowing you’ll be getting a great product.
customer_reviews.author: K. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Repeat customer
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for me for my long runs. I am training for marathon #7, and these have saved my life in training and in poorly organized runs.
customer_reviews.author: AdamK

customer_reviews.title: It's a big bottle - a little heavy, but the holder is awesome for keys/gel packs.
customer_reviews.text: I like running with a little smaller bottle than this one. It's a bit heavy and bulky for running. The pouch fits other waterbottles though and is perfect sized for a keys and a couple treats/dog bags/gel packs.
customer_reviews.author: SoundEng

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: water stays cold for those hot day long runs! cheers!
customer_reviews.author: Phaduman

customer_reviews.title: It's comfortable and easy to hold
customer_reviews.text: It's comfortable and easy to hold. I have really small hands and it doesn't feel too bulky. Is a lifesaver when on runs. The camelback doesn't keep drinks cool in the Florida sun but I'm not sure anything would!
customer_reviews.author: Nicola Horton

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is ay too tall for me, awkward to carry and seems really weighted oddly. I rarely use it.
customer_reviews.author: blkoyle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for trail running
customer_reviews.text: This bottle works perfect for me. The storage pouch is the perfect size to hold an iPhone 6s and a car key. The larger 21oz bottle is an added bonus. It is light weight and comfortable to run with.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: It arrived very quickly and I love it! I've taken it on 15+ mile runs ...
customer_reviews.text: It arrived very quickly and I love it! I've taken it on 15+ mile runs and it hasn't bothered me at all. I can fit a few gels plus my iPod in it. The water stays cool for about 1.5 hours as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for long distance running
customer_reviews.text: Wobbles back and forth on your hand if you're not gripping it. Would not recommend for a long run where you want relaxed hands.
customer_reviews.author: Gida

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I can run without either running into a drugstore and buying a bottle of water or feeling like I'm going to die halfway through my run! Haven't tried running with my Iphone plus yet though. We'll see.
customer_reviews.author: shngu

customer_reviews.title: Good bottle for running
customer_reviews.text: Good bottle for running. Only issue is that the straps do not keep the bottle snug to my hand. They always lose their tension while running.
customer_reviews.author: Chris R

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t stay cold any bedder than a glass of water ...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t stay cold any bedder than a glass of water. Hand strap is only going for people with large hands. Leaks
customer_reviews.author: C. Buckley

customer_reviews.title: Great for running
customer_reviews.text: Great for running! Water stays cold, pocket is just big enough for a phone.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Good bottle- not so good strap.
customer_reviews.text: Good insulation. Mouthpiece shut off valve very helpful. Wide mouth easy to fill. One problem is hand held strap uncomfortable and hard to position.
customer_reviews.author: Trailpope

customer_reviews.title: Best water bottle for running
customer_reviews.text: My son is in the Army and loves this bottle. Has run 2 1/2 marathons with it. Excellent quality
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my husband and he really likes it
customer_reviews.author: Oon Suan

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok.
customer_reviews.text: Nice to take on walks. Ice melts quickly. Not big enough for a good gym workout. Holds small phone.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Product If you are looking for it to keep your beverage cold
customer_reviews.text: This product is horrible. For the price, its way too expensive and your cold beverage is warm within an hour. Its super convenient to use when exercising etc but don't purchase it if you want it to keep your beverage cold/hot.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa S Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice design, able to put cell in pocket. Good for the runner/ biker
customer_reviews.author: randy the rodent

customer_reviews.title: Was very happy and liked using so much more than a running ...
customer_reviews.text: Used for a 15k. Was very happy and liked using so much more than a running belt or pouch.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia

customer_reviews.title: the nipple came out :(
customer_reviews.text: Now it leaks if I tip it over because the nipple of the cap came out. I am unable to put it back in. Before that, it was great and I even used it when running a half marathon on a hot day. It also fits my bike. I want my money back or a free replacement cap...
customer_reviews.author: Addy

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and doesn't leak
customer_reviews.text: I use this when I run and it is comfortable and convenient. The lid screws on tightly and doesn't leak. The little pocket is perfect for keys and id's, but a little too small for a phone.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice and roomy pocket for a key or a snack.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Bad design
customer_reviews.text: This device doesn't stay taught on your hand. Keeps getting loose. Can't run with it. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Maybe this works for people with larger hands but those ...
customer_reviews.text: Maybe this works for people with larger hands but those with smaller hands this doesn't work. I tried it once and it was such a struggle to run with it, my arms hurt and I had to keep switching arms. It was not a enjoyable run. I give it 2 stars because I liked the band that fits your phone and such.
customer_reviews.author: Major Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to carry
customer_reviews.text: This was a good product and fit comfortable in my hand. The only problem the water didn’t stay cold for very long.
customer_reviews.author: Bella 75

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this for my marathon training! You can fit a lot of stuff in that little pouch (keys, fuel, credit card) and it is very comfortable to hold while running.
customer_reviews.author: Luisa C

customer_reviews.title: Nice running bottle
customer_reviews.text: Adjustable, easy on the hand and holds the bottle in place.
customer_reviews.author: Mike I

customer_reviews.title: Clunky and uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: It’s clunky and the hand strap is extremely uncomfortable. The material kept scratching my hand and left a rash. Would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice hydration option
customer_reviews.text: Easy to carry and the little bag fits my big iPhone 📱 max
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Mize-Cuadro

customer_reviews.title: and is still pretty comfortable to hold on runs
customer_reviews.text: Though I wish there was a thumb grip, I'm not picky and I can't complain. Holds a plentiful amount of water, and is still pretty comfortable to hold on runs.
customer_reviews.author: James Vu

customer_reviews.title: Great bottle
customer_reviews.text: Love these bottle especially since they flex and are not rock hard and break
customer_reviews.author: Kls0307

customer_reviews.title: Holds enough for a 3-4 mile run.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, love the zipper pocket for keys and ID when you go out for a run. I l8ke the adjustable strap.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Velez

customer_reviews.title: MOLD--DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I've had for under a month and the mold is the actual mouthpiece is nasty--I've tried everything to clean and no luck.
customer_reviews.author: Alice James

customer_reviews.title: Stay cold inside but gets wet outside
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great water bottle. Liquids stay cold. Only problem it sweats. Outside of the bottle gets wet and slippery
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuelle Flax

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for walking. Holds my iPhone, key, and $. Just the right size.
customer_reviews.author: MJ Goetz

customer_reviews.title: I love this water bottle
customer_reviews.text: I love this water bottle. I use it when I run. The strap works great for me, to keep the bottle on my hand. At times it will loosen up a bit, but it's not a big deal, I just tighten it back up. Also, the pocket can hold my cell phone.
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Easy hand held water bottle
customer_reviews.text: Great handheld water bottle. Can holds in keys in pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for spin class or going for a run
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to use for spin class and when I go on a run.
customer_reviews.author: Mom in GA

customer_reviews.title: The bottle is not comfortable while running
customer_reviews.text: The bottle is not comfortable while running. The storage pouch is good, but the bottle moves too much while running, even with tightening strap.
customer_reviews.author: Angie Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Fungus found in the cap
customer_reviews.text: The product we received had fungus or some dirt in the cap area
customer_reviews.author: Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for waking/running. Holds my iPhone and keys perfectly. Keeps water cold
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Easy to carry
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for. Keeps my water cold on long runs and holds my phone and money. Easy to carry. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hall

customer_reviews.title: Hand strap issues
customer_reviews.text: Received this bottle yesterday and took it out for a 12 mile run today. Here are my thoughts: Pros: 1. My drink stayed nice and cold. The insulation is great. 2. Size is great for longer runs 3. I liked the mouth nozzle Cons; 1. The hand strap is really two pieces. The padded piece and the adjustable reflective strap. Several times when I pulled the strap tighter it would come off the padding. I had to fiddle with it many times during my run 2. The hand strap / padding piece chaffed my hand. The underside was not comfortable. Overall I won't be using this bottle again due to the hand strap issues. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: KBME

customer_reviews.title: Faulty spout. It makes a constant sputtering noise after ...
customer_reviews.text: Faulty spout. It makes a constant sputtering noise after drinking from it. Both mine and my boyfriend's does it and if we drink from it at night we have to listen to the sound for minutes until it subsides. Very bothersome.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Ideas good, but needs to be redesigned.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an older handheld CamelBak water bottle holder. I'd have to say I've been disappointed. My old one had some elastic in the hand loop which helped to hold it in place. I rarely had to adjust it. This one constantly comes loose and I have to tighten it, and that's without having my phone in the pocket. If I carry my phone, it's way worse and it comes loose all the time. I rarely can loosen my grip and let my hand relax while I'm carrying just a bottle. The only thing I'm happy with, is that it fits my phone but since it makes it loosen, I rarely take my phone along.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: This has been a great help to me on the longer runs during those ...
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great help to me on the longer runs during those warmer days. Though my water does not stay cold throughout the entire run, it is much better than the previous water bottle I was using. The strap works sufficiently but I find myself tightening up the strap several times throughout my run.... possibly because of the weight of the bottle/pouch on the opposing side. The pouch does hold quite a bit but I try to keep it to a minimum because of the weight. Overall, a good product and something I'll continue using.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer W

customer_reviews.title: Size matters
customer_reviews.text: I found this item to be heavy. I really like that it is round. Much easier to clean. My last 8oz bottle was oval shaped and had mold spots in it. However during a long run this item was very heavy. I am prone to stomach cramps and have to be careful what I eat and drink during runs so I have to carry a bottle. I wish camelbak made a smaller bottle maybe that held 8oz
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The grip does not fit my style of running, it causes discomfort in my arm
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this - I bought it to hold my key ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this - I bought it to hold my key and run with and it's great - the strap is easy to adjust, and it can hold a smaller phone if you don't want to carry two things while running.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Cooper

product_meta.title: CamelBak Quick Grip Chill Handheld Water Bottle
product_meta.description: The Quick Grip Chill lets you move light and fast, but holds enough water for a substantial 5 – 10 mile run. It also includes a zippered pouch with just enough room for the three true essentials: keys, card and phone. The extra stretch mesh pouch expands to fit an energy gel or two, and the velvetex-lined strap won’t chafe your hands over the long haul. And as always, the insulated Podium bottle keeps your drink cold from start to finish. Other features include reflectivity, a key clip and an adjustable cinch strap for a secure carry. The Podium bottle features patented Jet Valve technology with a lockout dial for leak-proof transport.
feature_bullets: Podium Chill 21 oz bottle keeps water cold 2X longer
Reflectivity for early morning or evening runs
Zippered essentials pocket for phones, cards and keys
Jet valve seals shut to prevent leaks while you run
Patented TruTaste technology keeps your water tasting clean

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
